maml:description.maml:para: Get an instance of an object representing SQL server
Get an instance of an object representing SQL server

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get an instance of SQL Server object for the given instance named 'localhost' through pipeline

maml:description.maml:para: Get an instance of SQL Server Agent Job
Get an instance of SQL Sever Agent job. you can give job name and server name as input.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get an Instance of a job with name as 'myjob' from the SQL Server instance 'localhost' through pipeline

maml:description.maml:para: Gets SSIS Catalog
Gets SSIS catalog object for default(SSISDB) catalog.
System.String

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets SSISDB catalog object for the given SQL Server connection

maml:description.maml:para: Get messages logged during ssis operation
Get messages logged during ssis operation. You can provide operation id, event message id and sql connection object as input.

maml:Description.maml:para: id for operation type from catalog.operations
id for operation type from catalog.operations

maml:description.maml:para: System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

dev:remarks.maml:para: get instance of message for inputs , 100008 as operation id and event message id as 2 for sql connection object of localhost
get message from catalog.event_messages with input as 2 and sql connection object for localhost.

maml:description.maml:para: Get instance of package execution object from SSIS catalog.executions table
Get instance of package execution object from SSIS catalog.executions table. You can provde sql connection object and execution id as input.
System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get instance of package execution object with input as 10008 and server name as localhost.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets SSIS catalog folder
Gets SSIS catalog folder object for the given catalog. You can provide catalog object or connection object to SQL Server instance as a parameter.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.Catalog

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets folder object for folder 'myFolder' in catalog given through pipeline
Gets folder object for folder 'myFolder' in the default catalog(SSISDB) of SQL Server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Gets SSIS environment
Gets SSIS environment object in the given catalog folder. You can provide folder object or folder name and Sql connection object as parameters.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Get-SsisEnvironment -EnvName 'myEnvironment'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets environment object for environment 'myEnvironment' in the catalog folder given through pipeline.
Gets environment object for environment 'myEnvironment' in folder 'myFolder' and server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Get an instance of SSIS Package
Get an instance of SSIS Package. you can provide foldername, package name and sql connection object as input.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.ProjectInfo System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get an instance of SSIS package named 'mypackage.dtsx' under project 'myproject' in sql server instance 'localhost'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Get-SsisProject -ProjectName 'myProject'|Get-SsisPackage -PackageName 'mypackage.dtsx'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get an instance of SSIS package named 'mypackage.dtsx' under project 'myproject' in sql server instance 'localhost' through the pipeline from folder 'myfolder' in default ssis catalog
Get an instance of SSIS package 'mypackage.dtsx' throguh pipeline in SSIS Project 'myproject' in SQL server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Gets SSIS Project
Gets SSIS project object in the given catalog folder. You can provide folder object or folder name and SQL connection object as parameters.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Get-SsisProject -ProjectName 'myProject'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets project object for project 'myProject' in the catalog folder given through pipeline.
Gets project object for project 'myProject' in folder 'myFolder' and server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Execute SQL Query
Execute SQL Query. You can provide query and sql connection object
System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Invoke-SqlQuery -SQLQuery 'SELECT * FROM SSISDB.catalog.event_messages'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes any sql query which is passed as a input

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke SSIS Package
Invoke SSIS package based on specified inpus. you can provide project name, folder name, environmanet name and refrences and sql connection object
System.String Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.EnvironmentReference System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection System.Boolean System.Int32

dev:remarks.maml:para: Call SSIS package from SSIS catalog folder based on the values on names of package, folder and SQL connection along with reference to Environment as input.
Call SSIS package from SSIS catalog folder depending on the values on names of package, folder in which package is present along with SQL connection.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisProject -ProjectName 'myProject' -FolderName 'myfolder' | Get-SsisPackage -PackageName 'myPackage' -Project 'myProject' | Invoke-SsisPackage -Synchronized

dev:remarks.maml:para: Call SSIS package based in references to SSIS Project, package along with SQL server connection as input

maml:description.maml:para: Add environment reference to SQL job

Add reference to environment value created in SSIS catalog folder to a step inside SQL Job. You have to provide enviornment folder name, project name, package name, environment name and SQL Server connection as input.
System.String

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates reference of environment 'myEnvironment' in the Job 'myJob' provided through pipeline
Creates reference based on values from example1.json through piepline

maml:description.maml:para: Create a SQL agent job in SQL Server
Create a SQL Agent job in a SQL server Instance. Parameters are added in json file.
System.String

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create SQL jobs based on values specified in the 'SQLJob.json' through the pipeline for sql server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new connection object for the given SQL server instance.
Creates a new SQL Server connection object. You can provide a target server instance name or connection string as input.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new SQL Server connection object for the 'localhost' using server instance name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ConnectionString "Data Source=localhost;Initial Catalog=master;Integrated Security=SSPI;"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new SQL Server connection object for the 'localhost' using connection string

maml:description.maml:para: Creates SSIS catalog folder
Creates SSIS catalog folder in the given catalog. You can provide catalog object or SQL Server connection as input
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.Catalog

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates catalog folder 'myFolder' in the catalog provided through pipeline
Creates catalog folder 'myFolder' in the default catalog(SSISDB) of SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Creates catalog folder(s) specified in the parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates SSIS environment
Creates SSIS environment in the given catalog folder. You can provide folder object or folder name and SQL Server connection as input
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | New-SsisEnvironment -EnvName 'myEnvironment'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates environment 'myEnvironment' in catalog folder provided through pipeline
Creates environment 'myEnvironment' in catalog folder 'myFolder' in SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Creates environment(s) specified in parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates SSIS environment variable
Created SSIS environment variable in the given environment. You can provide environment object or folder name, environment name and SQL Server connection as input
System.TypeCode System.Object Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.EnvironmentInfo System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Get-SsisEnvironment -EnvName 'myEnvironment' | New-SsisEnvironmentVariable -VarName 'myVar' -VarType String -VarValue 'my value' -VarSensitive $false -VarDescription 'my value description'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates variable 'myVar' in the environment provided through pipeline

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $SqlServerConn = New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' PS C:\> New-SsisEnvironmentVariable -VarName 'myVar' -VarType String -VarValue 'my value' -VarSensitive $false -VarDescription 'my value description' ` >> -EnvName 'myEnvironment' -FolderName 'myFolder' -SqlServerConnection $SqlServerConn

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates variable 'myVar' in environment 'myEnvironment' in folder 'myFolder' in SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Creates variable(s) specified in parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates SSIS project
Creates SSIS project in the given folder from the ISPAC file. You can provide folder object or folder name and SQL Server connection
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | New-SsisProject -ProjectName 'myProject'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates project 'myProject' in catalog folder provided through pipeline
Creates project 'myProject' in catalog folder 'myFolder' in SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Creates projects(s) specified in parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates environment reference to a SSIS Project
Creates environment reference to the given SSIS project. You can provide the project object or folder name, project name and SQL Server connection as input
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.ProjectInfo System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Get-SsisProject -ProjectName 'myProject' | New-SsisProjectEnvReference -EnvName 'myEnvironment' -EnvFolderName 'myFolder'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates reference of environment 'myEnvironment' in the project provided through pipeline
Creates reference of environment 'myEnvironment' to project 'myProject' in folder 'myFolder' in SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Creates reference based on values from example1.json through piepline

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a SQL Job from SQL server instance
Remove SQL Agent job from SQL server. You can provide job name and sql connection as input.
System.String

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove SQL jobs based on values specified in the ParamFilePath through the pipeline for sql server instance 'localhost'
Remove SQL jobs with the name specified for JobName parameter through the pipeline for sql server instance 'localhost'

maml:description.maml:para: Delete SSIS Catalog Folder
Creates SSIS catalog folder in the given catalog. You can provide catalog object or SQL Server connection as input
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.Catalog System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes catalog folder 'myFolder' in the catalog provided through pipeline
Deletes catalog folder 'myFolder' in the default catalog(SSISDB) of SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Deletes catalog folder(s) specified in the parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Delete SSIS Environment
Delete SSIS environment in the given catalog folder. You can provide folder object or folder name and SQL Server connection as input
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SqlServerConnection -ServerName 'localhost' | Get-SsisCatalog | Get-SsisCatalogFolder -FolderName 'myFolder' | Remove-SsisEnvironment -EnvName 'myEnvironment'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Delete environment 'myEnvironment' in catalog folder provided through pipeline
Delete environment 'myEnvironment' in catalog folder 'myFolder' in SQL Server instance 'localhost'
Deletes environment(s) specified in parameter file 'example1.json'

maml:description.maml:para: Remove SSIS Job from SQL server Instance
Delete a SSIS project from SQL Server instance based on specified parameters.
Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.IntegrationServices.CatalogFolder System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection
